images.title: School Bell Vibration
images.description: Diagram showing a school bell being struck by a hammer, producing vibrations that create sound waves radiating outward in concentric circles. Illustrates how mechanical vibration of solid objects produces sound.

images.title: Vocal Cords Diagram
images.description: Anatomical diagram of vocal cords showing how air from the lungs passes through the vocal cords, causing them to vibrate and produce sound. Demonstrates human voice production mechanism.

images.title: Rubber Band Vibration
images.description: Diagram of a stretched rubber band showing plucking action and the resulting back-and-forth vibrational motion that produces sound. Illustrates how elastic materials vibrate when plucked.

images.title: Reflection of Sound Experiment
images.description: Experimental setup demonstrating sound reflection using cardboard tubes positioned at angles on a hard plywood surface with soft wood base. Shows how sound reflects similar to light with equal angles of incidence and reflection.

images.title: Sound Wave Compression and Rarefaction
images.description: Diagram showing a tuning fork producing sound waves with regions of compression (C) and rarefaction (R). Illustrates longitudinal wave nature of sound with varying air pressure regions traveling in the direction of wave propagation.

images.title: Musical Instruments Vibration Chart
images.description: Comparison chart showing three types of musical instruments: sitar with vibrating strings, flute with vibrating air column, and drum with vibrating membrane. Demonstrates different mechanisms of sound production in musical instruments.
